definition: to get wet in the rain
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: One day if I cannot take your umbrella that I will accompany you in the rain.
sentences.chinese: 有天如果我不能替你撐傘那我就陪你淋雨。

sentences.english: His hair was plastered down to his scalp by the rain.
sentences.chinese: 他的頭髮淋雨後緊貼在頭皮上。

sentences.english: Keep this product away from rain and wetness.
sentences.chinese: 勿讓本產品淋雨或受潮。

sentences.english: I am here to accompany you to wind and rain.
sentences.chinese: 我壹直在這裏，陪你吹風淋雨。

sentences.english: I love the rain, then quietly looked at his left side.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡淋雨，然後安靜的看着自己的左邊。

sentences.english: When did I say we could run through the rain and not get wet?
sentences.chinese: 我什麼時候說過我們淋雨不會溼啊？

sentences.english: He said I look like rain sometimes crying.
sentences.chinese: 他說我淋雨的樣子有時像在哭。

sentences.english: However, precaution, people should avoid the rain.
sentences.chinese: 但謹慎起見，民衆應避免淋雨。

sentences.english: "Basil, " said his father, "you may go out in the rain.
sentences.chinese: “巴茲爾，”父親說，“你現在可以出去淋雨了。”

sentences.english: I have rain falling in the concert - that couldn't work.
sentences.chinese: 我在演唱會上要淋雨的裝置也不能工作。

sentences.english: A person heavy rain is lonely.
Basil, " said his father, "you may go out in the rain. "
sentences.chinese: “巴茲爾，”父親說，“你現在可以出去淋雨了。”

sentences.english: Pedro:Well, I prefer rain to dullness.
sentences.chinese: 我寧願淋雨也不願意無聊。

definition: to blow cold/damping expectations by discouraging or realistic words
to take shelter from the rain
